intro: Galeopsis dubia proles nepetifolia, commonly known as the lesser hedge-nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lamiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flowers arranged in whorled clusters, which bloom in late summer. It is often found in moist habitats such as meadows, stream banks, and woodland edges. Galeopsis dubia proles nepetifolia is a perennial herb that is native to Europe and parts of Asia.
